{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3486827,"name":"Will C","username":"Suppdog222","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/suppdog222/{size}/256515_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T19:50:15.304Z","cooked":"

Our team having a problem with Onshape where assemblies won’t load and the same person is appearing in an assembly multiple times. We have about 7 people working together to CAD different mechanisms, and it’s making it physically impossible to get any work done. This is our first year using Onshape and up until this point we haven’t had any problems. Has anyone experienced anything like this before or know how to possibly fix it?

For reference, its showing 12 people in a certain assembly when only 1 person has it open, and showing the same person in it multiple times.

What browser are you using? In my case switching from Safari to Chrome fixed my issue with documents not loading. On that note, have you recently changed anything? Browser? Wifi setup?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T20:01:48.367Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482532,"topic_slug":"problems-with-onshape-please-help","display_username":"Silas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51263,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/problems-with-onshape-please-help/482532/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486860,"name":"Drew B.","username":"Drew_B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drew_b/{size}/194417_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T20:22:16.588Z","cooked":"

Slowness like this can happen, but it’s not common. It depends a lot on what you’re doing and how things are organized.

Are all 7 people working in the same Onshape document? If so, is this on one robot subassembly, or is the whole robot being designed in one document?

When you are seeing multiple user icons for the same person, that means their session has timed out and the Onshape servers are stuck performing some operation and haven’t ended that instance of the user in the document.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T20:22:16.588Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":148.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482532,"topic_slug":"problems-with-onshape-please-help","display_username":"Drew B.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22795,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PTC/Onshape Senior Education Solutions Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/problems-with-onshape-please-help/482532/5","custom_user_title":"PTC/Onshape Senior Education Solutions Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486874,"name":"","username":"Mangos","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mangos/{size}/208435_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T20:27:59.093Z","cooked":"

I’ve had a similar issue before, the only “fix” I did was to log out of Onshape on every computer and exit the browser. The document slowly emptied over time. The whole process took around 15-30 mins.

The robot is being designed in 1 document with multiple part studios and assemblies within. We had 4 people working together in the assembly that was having most the problems, and had 3 exit when it stopped working. The other 3 people were each in a different assembly / part studio by their self.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T20:38:02.823Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":40.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482532,"topic_slug":"problems-with-onshape-please-help","display_username":"Will C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22795,"username":"Drew_B","name":"Drew B.","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drew_b/{size}/194417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66211,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design"},"post_url":"/t/problems-with-onshape-please-help/482532/7","custom_user_title":"3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486886,"name":"Drew B.","username":"Drew_B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drew_b/{size}/194417_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T20:37:28.193Z","cooked":"

Designing the robot in one document is definitely going to lead to more issues down the road, so now is the best time to split it up.

Onshape computes all document tabs in parallel, so when you have multiple users working on the same document and on large complex tabs, the document needs to compute all of these actions at the same time and propagate them to all users. This creates performance issues and is most likely the cause of what you’re seeing.

The instant updates are nice when everything is in one document, but splitting each subassembly into its own document multiplies the total amount of computing resources you will have. It also reduces the number of total users in each document which also helps.

I’d recommend taking a look at the organization info on Best Practices | FRCDesign.org as it has a more in-depth explanation of how to set this up for your team.

If you need more help or have specific questions, feel free to DM me as well

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T20:40:15.969Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":174.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482532,"topic_slug":"problems-with-onshape-please-help","display_username":"Drew B.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.frcdesign.org/best-practices/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Best Practices | FRCDesign.org","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66211,"username":"Suppdog222","name":"Will C","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/suppdog222/{size}/256515_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22795,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PTC/Onshape Senior Education Solutions Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/problems-with-onshape-please-help/482532/8","custom_user_title":"PTC/Onshape Senior Education Solutions Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486955,"name":"Eklavya Agrawal","username":"Riklik1984","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/riklik1984/{size}/244911_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T21:46:41.159Z","cooked":"

As Drew_B said, splitting it up would be your best solution. 4192 uses a split document setup that we work well with. In our setup, we have a main document with deriving the master off into linked documents and importing those back into the main.

To be more specific, let’s take our drivetrain as an example. Our main document has a master and full robot w/ field setup.

JR25-00-Master2547×3296 911 KB

JR25-00

We derive a master from this, so the drivetrain master is chosen (the blue master)
The specific sketch is derived into a linked document:

JR25-00-DT-Main1513×838 282 KB

JR25-01-DT

As shown on the left-hand side, the derived feature is used so we can be as parametric as possible. we build the defining features up and assemble them, then move them all back to the original JR-00 document for our main robot.

JR25-00-Robot1476×832 253 KB

You can see that on the left there are versions, they are useful for making the final document what you want…I don’t know if that in your document you could have separate versions for each assembly, but by splitting it up you can!

By using this method to split it up, you can easily prototype and make changes to documents, all without worrying about the main assembly breaking or any parts of the original robot being affected: they will only change if you change which version they are linked to. It also helps with working on the robot with less lag - as there are fewer instances for onshape and you to compute.

Let me know if you have any questions or need any help setting it up!
